text: The International Institute of Social History (Dutch: Internationaal Instituut voor Sociale Geschiedenis; abbreviation: IISG) is a historical research institute in Amsterdam. It was founded in 1935 by Nicolaas Posthumus. It has collections of the most works and manuscripts by socialist including Karl Marx, Friedrich Engels and Rosa Luxemburg. It is now part of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences. == Other websites == * International Institute of Social History, Amsterdam, Netherlands: The Official Website Category:1935 establishments in Europe Category:1930s establishments in the Netherlands Category:Organizations based in the Netherlands
title: International Institute of Social History
